text: RT @BBCEssex: The @EnvAgency is urging people in #Essex to avoid becoming "accidental criminals" - by checking businesses before using them‚Ä¶
I have had this little friend with me all morning. Her views on the systematic erosion of the @EnvAgency sewage discharge permitting system is unprintable. https://t.co/XDMZobMw6j

The @EnvAgency is urging people in #Essex to avoid becoming "accidental criminals" - by checking businesses before using them to get rid of their rubbish. It's part of efforts to prevent fly-tipping. More info: https://t.co/1SgOtlPR1l (stock image) https://t.co/JFw4BDK87u

Great to see natural flood management prioritised in #FCERMStrategy - reconnected rivers & floodplains  resplendent in species rich habitats, eg #floodplainmeadows, are not just glorious but vital for flooding resilience. Need to properly invest in this! @EnvAgency @DefraWater https://t.co/165AqVPqtT

@Leeds_Highways @MethleyVillage @BAMNuttall @LeedsFAS @LeedsCC_CEAQ @ConnectingLeeds @LeedsCC_News @EnvAgencyYNE @LeedsRecycles Appears to be shifting earth out of the village along Lower Mickletown this morning.

@EnvAgency It is not acceptable for them to carry on the standard practice of emptying their slurry onto harvested #maize fields in February when there is no growing crop and before cultivating. #rivers #flooding #pollution

@EnvAgency Not the chronic ones. Time to agree the farming rules for water is a law, not just an occasional friendly phone call to advise. Please remind farmers now, before they tip the contents of their slurry stores on the fields again this winter. Especially those maize fields.
@EnvAgencySE @Twitter Thanks for the support @EnvAgencySE!
